text: The land speaks to those who listen - Kenaitze Oral Traditions - Elder Qenaga
When the salmon return, so does our hope - Kenaitze Oral Traditions - Elder Ch'ak'da
The mountains teach us patience - Kenaitze Oral Traditions - Elder Nulchina
In the silence of winter, wisdom grows - Kenaitze Oral Traditions - Elder Qenaga
The river's path is never straight, like life - Kenaitze Oral Traditions - Elder Ch'ak'da
When the eagle soars, so should our thoughts - Kenaitze Oral Traditions - Elder Nulchina
The bear's strength lies not in its claws, but in its wisdom - Kenaitze Oral Traditions - Elder Qenaga
In the dance of the northern lights, we see our ancestors - Kenaitze Oral Traditions - Elder Ch'ak'da
The moose teaches us to stand tall in adversity - Kenaitze Oral Traditions - Elder Nulchina
When the berries ripen, so does our understanding - Kenaitze Oral Traditions - Elder Qenaga
The wind carries stories of old - Kenaitze Oral Traditions - Elder Ch'ak'da
In the tracks of the wolf, we find our path - Kenaitze Oral Traditions - Elder Nulchina
The fire's warmth teaches us community - Kenaitze Oral Traditions - Elder Qenaga
When the snow falls, so does our pride - Kenaitze Oral Traditions - Elder Ch'ak'da
The raven's call brings change - Kenaitze Oral Traditions - Elder Nulchina
The spruce tree stands tall through all seasons - Kenaitze Oral Traditions - Elder Qenaga
In the river's flow, we find our way - Kenaitze Oral Traditions - Elder Ch'ak'da
The ptarmigan teaches us adaptation - Kenaitze Oral Traditions - Elder Nulchina
When the ice breaks, so do our fears - Kenaitze Oral Traditions - Elder Qenaga
The otter's play reminds us of joy - Kenaitze Oral Traditions - Elder Ch'ak'da
